item.description: widgetframe (function() { // If window.HTMLWidgets is already defined, then use it; otherwise create a // new object. This allows preceding code to set options that affect the // initialization process (though none currently exist). window.HTMLWidgets = window.HTMLWidgets || {}; // See if we're running in a viewer pane. If not, we're in a web browser. var viewerMode = window.HTMLWidgets.viewerMode = /\bviewer_pane=1\b/.test(window.location); // See if we're running in Shiny mode.

datatables (function() { // If window.HTMLWidgets is already defined, then use it; otherwise create a // new object. This allows preceding code to set options that affect the // initialization process (though none currently exist). window.HTMLWidgets = window.HTMLWidgets || {}; // See if we're running in a viewer pane. If not, we're in a web browser. var viewerMode = window.HTMLWidgets.viewerMode = /\bviewer_pane=1\b/.test(window.location); // See if we're running in Shiny mode.
